What a fantastic park full of contemporary sculptures. We walked around several hours jus admiring the from every angle. And everything is for free. There is a small box from where we picked up a brochure about all the sculptures. We also learned that there's an online guide,

It was a very hot day, so that didn't help in our enjoyment. Plus, we have been to many sculpture parks, so this one was a total disappointment. If you haven't been to a sculpture park, then it would be ok. We made a special stop to see this and I was so sad that it was just
The most interesting sculpture was the one of a upper torso made of steel white alphabet letters. You could walk inside of it.
Wow, I love this attraction park. It was so beautiful walking through it at night. The lights made it feel a little romantic when my partner and I went there for a date.

If you like modern art and sculpture you must visit! If you are a photographer you must visit! If you like to wander around after eating at one of the many nearby places to eat you must visit! Best bet is to park nearby on the street and plug a meter. A handful of pocket change

2019 marks the 10th anniversary of the John and Mary Pappajohn Sculpture Park features artwork by 24 of the world’s most celebrated artists. The nearly 5 acre park, located in downtown Des Moines. This accessible wide open setting, coupled with the skilled landscape design and

We scheduled a tour of the Pappajohn Sculpture Park through the museum, and it was an absolute highlight of our time in Des Moines! Having a guide to talk through the sculptures, the artists, the setting, etc, with us made the experience so much more enjoyable and educational.

Sitting squarely in downtown is this city block with an amazing collection of world class art- major pieces by Indiana, Kelly and Splenda to name a few. Park and wander as it grabs you- free admission. Street parking is available.

Fun to look at art and take pictures, new sculptures had been added since I went 2 years ago. Wish there was more info on the art. Also I know why you're not supposed to touch or climb, but it's very tempting.
Beautiful park with lots of photo opportunities. Kids can touch and play on the sculptures. Great modern art with lots of seating areas and grassy areas to sit.

The Pappajohn Sculpture Park is the jewel of Des Moines artistic public space. The collection is impressive and the landscape design beautiful. It is accessible to everyone, and it contributes to the cultural life of Des Moines and Iowa. It has transformed Downtown Des Moines

Today my husband and I stopped at the sculpture park to play Pokémon Go. This is one of my favorite locations for Pokémon Go in the Des Moines metro. The sculptures are nice too if you are into that sort of thing.
we got there on Sunday morning, (free parking before 9 am) and did the sunrise through the sculptures and looked at the different building around there. just a couple people sleeping on the benches.

Pappajohn Sculpture Park is an unexpected gem located downtown Des Moines between Grand and Locust. It features sculptures created by a variety of international artists, each expressing his/her own voices.

Great place to walk thru any day and time! Can call in and get audio on your phone. Didn't have enough time for this but would do it next time. Can look and observe at your own pace and have a picnic as well.
Easy to get to is not that big but the sculptures are really nice and well put togeather is a must see if in the area
While not all the pieces were what I liked, there were a variety of sculptures and the park as a whole is great. Restaurants and cafes, along with breweries were in close proximity.
Scenic park in the middle of downtown. No cost to visit. Simple park but good views. Worth the quick visit.

Lol the art is strange but it’s worth checking out. Easy parking lining the streets and a variety of food within walking distance. Very safe and clean. Fun for taking photos and letting the kiddos stretch their legs. Free to the public and real pretty at night!
Saw this park while attending the Arts Festival (which I strongly recommend). Sculptures are okay, but by itself, the park is a 20-minute stop, at best.

The park displays about 2 dozen large sculptures. Some of my favorite sculptures are the two heads at the east side. A friend and I were here during the art festival recently. If you are here just to see the park, 1 hour is enough. If you want to enjoy the festival, plan on two
This was such a welcomed surprise. Walking a well manicured park with sculpture so amazing you literally are mesmerized with some.

When we saw how highly this was recommended we knew we had to put this on our list of places to visit in Des Moines. Meh. It's not great for families as all my kids wanted to do was climb on all of the sculptures and run up and down the embankments.

Located in the middle of downtown, this is a great place to take a walk or a break from the hustle and bustle of your day. We stopped on our vacation after seeing reviews. There are a large amount of sculptures that you can check out (non-interactive for the most part), but
Great place to visit. Came here during the set up for arts festival there were so many inspiration and imaginative pieces.

We started our afternoon at the State Historical Museum, then walked up to the Capitol Building and enjoyed taking pictures and then drove a short distance to the Pappajohn Sculpture Park. We had a blast and it was all 100% free.
To be honest I can take or leave this kind of stuff but my husband who is an artist thought this place was fantastic. He and the kids loved exploring all of the different sculptures.

Interesting. Unfortunately the phone discussions were not working properly when we went so we did not understand what we were looking at on many instances. However, the statutes could be appreciated for their art
This 1 city block length of land hosts interesting, thought provoking, funny and awe inspiring sculptures.

Nice collection of art with benches so you could sit and enjoy a summer evening (a nice bonus when you have mobility limitations). Many people at the park when we were there. Several people walking their dogs or enjoying time with their children.
Every city has their little treasure and this one is Des Moines. We walked around one afternoon before heading to dinner. Beautiful work. The city is lucky to have this.
The Pappajohn Sculpture park is a must see in downtown Des Moines. The artwork is very unique and thought provoking. It's a great place to take a sack lunch and just enjoy the unusual sculptures.

I walked through the park to view the statures and thought they were just ok. I kinda felt like they just put them there to make a tourist attraction. To me none of the statures were really grand or something that was really unique.

The sculpture garden has a wide variety of art in which you can view at your own pace. Most sculptures have an identification plaque and contains a number for an audio tour which you access through your phone. I’m not very artsy but my 10year old & I had a fun time guessing

Favorite sculptures were Ancient forest and Juno From a distance some of the sculptures don’t seem as impressive as when you are standing near them. The sculptures don’t have individual placards so you definitely want to get a map that has the sculptures names and descriptions.
Nice park with a wide variety of sculptures. The surrounding buildings complement the scene well. Highly recommend you finish your walk by visiting the vintage car shop and a pit stop at Exile.

Lotsa people walking around the open grassy area of this park. Nice. Sculptures are interesting. Not a big fan of abstract art, but still worth coming to see. Liked the pumpkin, the body made out of letters and the color circle; with translucent glass and mirrors of different
I enjoy walking on date night. Great atmosphere, lit well, nicely maintained. Some of the art is very odd and others are awesome. I guess odd strikes up conversation...

The sculpture park in Des Moines is well worth seeing with pieces that are both challenging to the imagination and show a high degree of technically mastery in the work. Geometric, abstract and surreal, they are wonderful talking points and inspiring to your own ideas.

There is something for everyone in this park. Some of the sculpture will not be to your liking; that’s because every style is on show. It’s free and it’s worth a quick 20 minute stroll. Take someone with you and take some zany photos!
Take a quick stop here to see some cool sculptures. There are great photo ops as well. We enjoyed our walk around the park.
We stopped here in a light rain. Still it was interesting. Can't say my young boys were to impressed.

I was looking for something to see while in Des Moines and this place was recommended. Now I believe it would have been a little more enjoyable in sunny warm snowless weather but it still was fun. I didn't use the app for the guided tour. i just walked around the park and

Interesting outdoor sculpture park. We were trying to take in all of the city attractions. This would be great place to picnic in warmer weather or food truck stopping place
Easy to enjoy. I always make my way to this place when visiting Des Moines. You can spend as much or as little time as you want.

I visited Pappajohn Sculpture Park while in Des Moines. It is a very whimsical park with interesting sculptures throughout. At night the sculptures are lit up and it is visible upon entry to downtown Des Moines from the west.

There are tons of Pokemon things here-so says my husband and 13 year old who play it. We enjoy walking around, Pokemon hunting, and enjoying the artwork at this park. It is always clean and people are very friendly at it.

Any time of year is a good visit but this time of year with the surrounding walkways lit by holiday lights makes this one of the best times of the year to visit in the evening for a stroll admiring not only the lights but the artwork.

It was a beautiful day. Blue skies and temp in the 50's. We stayed in downtown Des Moines. Our fist time ever to Des Moines. We walked the skywalk to the sculpture park. It was awesome!! More sculptures than I ever imagined. Very impressive. Take the time to visit this. It's
Great place to wander when the weather is nice. More sculptures arriving regularly. Nicely situated near several great restaurants, the Merideth garden is close and open in summer.
An interesting walk through the park with several different sculptures, unique to see this many pieces of art in one area.
This is always a fun place to take some pictures , no matter which season. It’s lit at night to enjoy sculptures.
Unique sculpture park, surprisingly located right in the downtown area. Easily accessible by foot or vehicle. And it's free!

If you have time, definitely visit. Amazing structures with great stories and some decent exercise getting around too. So many sculptures and fun pictures to take, give yourself plenty of time to see everything.
I walked here from my hotel just hoping to get some fresh air and enjoy the afternoon. I was very impressed when I first walked up and I really enjoyed my time looking at the sculptures.
Most of these sculptures came from a private collection that was donated to the city. Some of them are a little strange. Beautiful park like setting.
Pretty cool not something you see everyday - this was a serendipitous visit and it was pretty cool to see - give it a look when your in town!

We are Des Moines residents and we love the sculpture park. My husband and I waked around the sculpture park after our first date, took some of our engagement pictures here, and walk our dogs here. It doesn’t matter how many times we go it’s always a nice place to visit!
there was quite an array of art ... right in the middle of the city!! The descriptions were a nice bonus. Park was clean.

Amazing moden sculptures ! Even saw a wedding happening beneath one. Varied mediums, themes & colors. Impressive use of city space. Peaceful & inviting.
We all know that Iowa is known for our boring entertainment and experiences. However, Pappajohn Sculpture Park makes everyone re-think about Iowa's creativity environment and progressive arts.
Love the moonrise east and moonrise west sculpture the best.. White ghost was next. September there was a world festival. Love city park with the water troughs. Kids love playing in them.

Just a lovely area in which to enjoy the outdoors near the public library, coffee shops, restaurants, hotels, offices and downtown Farmer’s Market & art fairs!

Give your negative politics a rest- if you have any about the owner of Papa John's and enjoy a great place for a walk. You can dine at several nearby restaurants or an ice cream store and then take 45 minutes out of an evening of viewing some wonderful outdoor art.

Stopped by Black Cat Ice Cream and walked around the Sculpture Garden as we ate it. A unique and fun collection of sculptures! A great layout as the art was well spaced and easy to enjoy. Suggest coming early or late in the day in the summer as there isn't much shade.

What a perfect place for a stroll on a summer evening. The array of sculptures if fabulous and features some well-known artists. I loved the self-guided map they provide so I could learn more about each piece of art.

The Pappajohn Sculpture Park is an interesting place to spend about 45 minutes wandering among a diverse collection of outdoor art sculptures. There are boxes scattered throughout the park that have informational brochures, which we found to be quite helpful in giving

This is a world class opportunity to see incredible sculptures and the experience is free and open to the public. The generosity of the donors is unrivaled. It is a treasure for Des Moines. Give yourself time to take it all in.

Stopped by as we were in the area downtown ...guess good to do on a dry day. Not many people around on the day we visited so it was perfect we were able to take photos without anyone in the background. Street parking was $1.25 for an hour which is perfect to walk around and
2nd visit to Des Moines and had to make a return visit to the sculpture park. Great place to take pictures. Just can't touch the sculptures.
It is a wide open ( no trees) park in downtown area.It has some very nice sculptures--and some nice ones----and some that you think " I could make that '.All in all---it's ok

We drove by this area numerous times before stopping to take a better look at the sculputures. There are some that need to be looked at from all angles. A few that are special, and you would want for your own property. These are gifts from a collection, and what a nice thing

A few sculptures were fabulous and a few were just so (personal taste), but I really appreciate the thought behind this park. The greens are banked to allow focus on the sculptures without other sculptures distracting you. Well worth a quick walk!

My boyfriend and I were in Des Moines for a wedding and stopped by the sculpture park on the way out of town. The Des Moines Art Festival was going on which really complemented the sculpture park nicely. There were some really cool sculptures and it was a good spot to get out of

It is a nice place to stop for a few minutes. Nothing special though. You can walk around, take pictures, and get back in your car in no time. I would never go out of my way to see the park. Honestly there are many other places in Des Moines where you can enjoy better art. Do
Traveled to Des Moines with a friend for the weekend and spent the day walking around downtown. This park was a nice reprieve from the busier areas of the city.
This is a beautiful open space in the heart of downtown. They've contracted some beautiful sculptures - art you and your kids will want to have their pictures taken with.
I took the free D-Line DART bus from my east village hotel, hopped off, walked around, enjoyed the sculptures and then hoped back on.
Explore several large pieces of sculpture. Ponder what makes something “art”. It is free and kid friendly.
Des Moines has this quaint feel about it even though it is a bigger city. This wonderful little sculpture park is one of the many surprises this city has to offer.
We just happened to be near here while we went to the Italian festival, It is a nice clean park with some nice sculptures.

Good family area. Interesting, different types of sculptures, love the horse, and the different colored glass wall sculpture, also the alphabet sculpture. Interesting with the alphabet, no words, just letters all the way around. The kids have lots of room to run, and they have

My husband and I visited here on a rainy day in June and it was still quite busy. Such a beautiful and restful green space in the middle of a busy city. Lovely sculptures with excellent picture taking options.

This is an open park in the middle of cool downtown buildings with easy parking along the curbs of the streets surrounding it. Free parking on Sundays. You can walk the paths or cut through the grassy paces to see each sculpture. Although you cannot climb on or touch the
We took some fun pictures when we visited. Lots of very interesting and pretty sculptures. No shade if you need that.
The park is located in downtown Des Moines, a small but very neat park. There is always plenty of street parking available.

Lots of sculptures to see as you walk around this park in downtown Des Moines. During the week lots of people on lunch breaks and just walking through to enjoy the day. It is surrounded by busy streets so not a relaxing park setting but great for people watching. No
I really love the art, sometimes I can’t understand some sculpture but it is not a problem. In this park I founded some interesting sculpture

This was a small area of really cool sculptures- weather was beautiful & it was easy to get to... there was a music festival just a couple blocks away & there wasn’t much traffic. Parked by a meter- paid for an hour but only needed about 30 minutes... save your quarters! 😍😊
Multiple large pieces of art in the open make for an interesting visit. Well-laid out, with additional information on each piece available via a self-guided audio cell-phone tour.
A great place to walk around and get pictures with some very interesting art. Street parking is plentiful.
There are a good number of large sculpture and art pieces dispersed in a large grassy park with sidewalks winding throughout.

Every time I visit this park there seems to be a new scultpure. Brochures are located by the signs for the park. They explain each statue if you're interested in learning about the artist's meaning. There are many different sculptures to enjoy!
IF you're in the area, then by all means walk around. However, don't make a special trip to see it. There are no explanations by any of the statues. So you just walk around it for 10-15 min.
Not worth the cost of parking. I wouldn’t waste your time. A handful of statues only. Worst part was there wasn’t a Papa Johns nearby.

We really enjoyed walking around this lovely park area and observing the sculptures. Admittedly, when we read the descriptions in the brochure back at our hotel, we were baffled by the meanings but the sculptures were fascinating nonetheless.
Love this park! Lots of beautiful diverse pieces and nice walking paths. Right downtown and close to everything!
Not huge, but nicely laid out with a number of sculptures in a tranquil park setting. Most enjoyable. Bring your camera
A lovely outing just west of the downtown area. Great for photos! A number of cafes and restaurants nearby. We walked around waiting for a table. Cool, contemporary art in downtown Des Moines!
Nice area to walk around and view various sculptures. Lots of shaded spots to sit and enjoy the surrounding things or sip on a coffee.
I came for a weekend stay to Des Moines with my family. We just had to stop at the sculpture park. It was definitely worth it! I would recommend for art lovers and non art lovers alike!

The sculptures are all cool and placed beautifully around a small park. A great place to visit. Nice walking path around the park and benches. There is street parking all around the park. Great stop to visit.

Not the sort of art exhibit that you would travel much distance to see. But if you are in town, it is worth a look. There are many nice restaurants and shops nearby too. Downtown Des Moines just keep getting nicer.

Walked around this park on a Saturday afternoon in early March. Didn't find the brochures about each installation, but the have plaques at each one with some info. We especially liked the circled, color mirror installation. We spent about an hour wandering around.

I have taken my family before with no issues and the kids played. This time I took friends and a few more kids anfld the security guard basically followed us around the entire park! It was rather annoying..our kids were not out of control but he kept coming over and repeating
This was very nice place to get out of the car and run around and take in some wonderful outdoor sculptures. Kids very much enjoyed it, and we were all impressed w the downtown area. Great place!

I didn’t realize this place existed but am really glad it popped up on “things to do” while we were in Des Moines. It’s a very nice park and the sculptures are all pretty amazing. Definitely a nice place to wander around and enjoy being outside.

Some of the statues here I hate! Others I love! You’ll have to come down and see for yourself :) it’s easy to get too and doesn’t take to long at all to stroll though so it’s worth checking out :) they also have phone guided tours so that’s always a plus 😛
I always take visitors here! I have a favorite piece or two, but I enjoy them all. Great to have this in the downtown area. And free, too!

The Pappajohn Sculpture Park is a fun place for the entire family. There are sculptures to climb on, to climb under, to run through, and to pause and use as backdrops for photos. A lot of people wander through the park at a leisurely pace and just enjoy the interesting
Take a stroll around this park after dinner in one of the nearby restaurants. It’s the perfect way to end a date night, visit with out of towners, or close a stressful day.

Nice green space downtown. Tech boys working in the area prolly enjoy lunch there on nice days. There are a few nice pieces but overall it fails as a sculpture garden. Locals don’t talk about it much unless there is a festival or food truck gathering or something else going on
Not many places can you enjoy world class art in a natural setting for FREE. In Des Moines' Gateway area. Many fantastic restaurants within walking distance.

Took my Granddaughter down and enjoyed Lunch before walking the park...I'm a graduate of the KC Art Institute and really could appreciate the talent and the work involved to create these magnificent sculptures....Must See...

We have wandered the park and taken some really fun family photos. Photos of our girls, Christmas card photos etc. Wonderful green space to walk and have a picnic, can go right from most offices downtown.
It was a fun to go and check the white ghost haha my fav! great location and fun to take pix around them.

The sculpture park is not worth a stand-alone visit, but it is cool to see. It covers two full city blocks on a rolling landscape. The sculptures are interesting, well done and worth visiting. There are 20+ sculptures to walk between and explore. The large 3-D man sitting

This is a great place to walk around downtown Des Moines. There are great pieces of art to look at and several restaurants and breweries not far away. When it is nice outside, I bring my lunches here and sit outside of the lunch hour and eat.
The sculpture park is a great place to bring family members of any age. Some of the sculpture pieces are interactive, some interesting, and some strange, but all are entertaining

The art is very expensive, beautiful to look at up close. No driving by to just look. Lots and Lots of different pieces. More fun the summer and fall than spring and winter Go look for yourself right down town...
The park is very clean and family friendly. It is was a giant hit for any Pokemon go users. The entire park walkthrough takes about 10-20 mins. Plenty of parking options around the block.
If you are visiting Des Mother bed stop by and visit our sculpture park. It's free and there are some great works of art featured in the collection.
The pieces are large and beautiful and a great way to stretchy your legs. Many of the pieces are open, so you can walk up to them or in them.

We stopped by the Pappajohn Sculpture Park after a family dinner, and we snapped a few family pictures by the sculptures. I am always impressed each time we visit downtown Des Moines over the years because it has changed significantly. There are green spaces, additional signage

We strolled through here on a cold Saturday afternoon. Wasn't busy at all so got some good photos of the sculptures, and only heard one group of screaming kids. We were surprised at how NOT busy downtown Des Moines is for being so large.

I love stopping at the Pappajohn Sculpture Park because no matter who I am with or how long I have to look and talk, I always get something interesting from the experience! Take your phone to look up information on one of the sculptures if you have a few minutes or on all of

The Sculpture Park is a beautiful and interesting collection of larger-than-life pieces set in a very nice green space at the West end of downtown Des Moines. The park takes up several city blocks and there are walkways that wind through it and benches to sit and linger. The

The garden is easily accessible in a large green space. There are works by 22 artists ranging from a large cylindrical wall of colored panels, a large hollow, incomplete head, things that look like spiders, trees, and abstracts. My only complaint is the information was coded to

Good street parking. Great spot to kill a hour or so looking at the different sculptures. Felt safe. I did read one review that said watch out for goose stuff everywhere-its actually from them aerating the grounds, it is not droppings.

Very nice place to visit. It's big enough to get some fresh air and exercise but small enough you don't feel like you've run a marathon. I was surprised at all the different style of sculpture they have.....BTW I got a GREAT picture of my Beautiful wife!!!
We enjoyed our walk around Pappajohn Sculpture Park. The sculptures were amazing, lots of different types and forms. Definitely worth a look!
Well-maintained park in downtown with some really nice sculptures and walking paths. It's pretty small, but free, and good for a short walk or walk with kids.

A group of 8 of us stopped and toured the park for about 1 hour. Mostly my teenage children and a few friends. We enjoyed looking at the sculptures and having a lighthearted discussion about different pieces. The kids enjoyed it much more than I expected and I’m glad we
This is a beautiful park in downtown Des Moines with lots of green space "littered" with various art sculptures. It's a great place for a leisurely walk.

I walked through the sculpture garden at 7pm. It is a very nice addition to the wonderful downtown experience that makes Des Moines such a great place to visit. Plenty of diverse artistic expressions for reflection. Definitely worth a visit.

Definitely worth a visit, many interesting contemporary pieces from international and American artists. Utilize the phone audio explanations or just come to your own conclusions of what the pieces mean. Also several good resturants facing the sculpture park on Locust Street.
This is a gorgeous setting! There's lushes grass, beautiful views, a winding pathway that leads you to every sculpture and there's a cell phone tour as you go!

Great place to spend a few hours enjoying a nice walk among many beautiful sculptures donated from a private collection. Located close to a newly designed library bldg. Nice place to pack a picnic, take young kids have a nice small wading pool. If do not want to pack a picnic

This sculpture park was a great addition to downtown. It's a great place to store around after work or during one of the many downtown festivals. The park is beautiful during the day as well as at night. Over the years the art has held up beautifully. Some pieces are on to

We have been traveling cross country and visited many sculpture parks.This one falls about in the middle.It has some interesting pieces and is well kept. Didn't take to long to see it ll, but was worth the stop.

Wasn't so crazy about this place when there were Pokémon zombies all over the place. But, that has died down, and the memory of walking through the park on a cool fall night, artwork lit up, city skyline glistening, watching the city come to life, is a great memory.
It was definitely worth seeing the sculptures where interesting. Not much for art the wife liked it and it didn't kill me.
Fun place for some photos, but you don't need a lot of time to see everything. It is a nice walk in a newly improved area of Des Moines.
This is a fun park to go for a walk and have a picnic lunch! Lots of sculptures to look at! The best thing is, it is free!

Took the free Des Moines bus out to this park. It has some great art set up in a very safe clean area of the city. We walked a few blocks and had good lunch with lots of restaurants nearby and also by the City Library which had nice grounds as well.
My kids roll their eyes at going to art museums, but sculpture parks offer a brilliant alternative and a great way to get outdoors and wander.

This is an interesting stop, but I wouldn't call this an "attraction" exactly. It's about a block wide and it's got some sculptures, but most of them are bizarre beyond words, and the title blocks for the pieces offer no insight. Interesting, but not great.
The grounds have been carefully sited to enhance each piece. This was way better than I expected. Great space for contemplative walk.

Good art is art to which one can return again and again. We've been to this sculpture garden many times and have enjoyed aspects of the art we've overlooked before. One can get lost in the art and and in thought. The topography sets off the artworks complementarily.

I love this piece of green space that has a couple of hills to enjoy the art at different angles. I have watched this sculpture park mature over the past few years. It just needs a few more trees to enhance the overall ambience. Great place for artsy pictures.

I wouldn't go out of my way to see it but it's not too far from downtown so if you're in the area it's worth checking out. I noticed a few sculptures were missing as well which was disappointing. Also kids were climbing all over some of them making it hard to get a clear picture

I'm no art enthusiast, but the big open park was nice to walk around and the eccentric sculptures were intriguing. Many families were there with their young children, who had plenty of room to run around safely.

We stopped at 10:30 on a Tuesday and were among a very few visitors; a middle school group arrived before we left. There’s on-street parking, free admission to this 2-block green space downtown and about 2.5 miles from the Des Moines Art Center, also on Grand Avenue. A range of

Loved all the interesting art. The only thing was that no touching the art (compared to the Minneapolis Sculpture garden) However the place is interesting along with the rest of downtown. The river-walk is nice this is definitely a very walk-able city .

This park is a great place to go if you like art and especially art sculpture. Scattered throughout the park is an amazing g selection. Set in this grassy area you will need to spend some time walking among them and enjoying them.
A neat, quiet place to walk around downtown. Kids are 10 & 8 and enjoyed the unique sculptures. Only took about an hour.
Great sculpture park along the edge of downtown Des Moines. This is definitely worth a stop while in Des Moines. You'll need some coins for the parking meter before 6pm.
What a treasure to visit in downtown - lots of seating to enjoy the impressive collection of eclectic sculptures. One of our favorite places to enjoy in the metro! Check it out!

The sculpture park is interesting. I don't have an "eye for art" so some of the sculptures were meaningless to me. The area is very nice if you want to grab a drink or bite to eat. there is no climbing on the art, so kids may have a hard time keeping interested. It doesn't
Nice spot to enjoy downtown Des Moines for a bit. Wide range of sculptures and a few restaurants and bars to visit afterwards along the park

Had not visited in a few years since moving away so took my Mom and nieces last Friday for a quick visit. We had fun exploring the sculptures, posing for pics and rolling down the hill (them, not me!). Only there for 30 minutes and most of the pieces I have seen before but
I love that the free sculpture park is near the middle of downtown! So neat to see the creativity and the green in the middle of the city. Beautiful all day long
Worth a walk through if you are close, but not something I would go way out of my to see. Interesting hour spent here.
it's free and you can spend some time leisurely there, good for whole family, we spend half hour there at an evening. The kids can run around there as well.
Not knowing what to expect in Iowa, this was a delightful find on a sunny afternoon. interesting, even provocative sculpture nicely presented.

The sculptures ranged from fascinating to blah, but the signage and the free brochures made it accessible and more-interesting. A few pieces made this really worth seeing (the ones in my pictures, and everyone else's too, I have noticed!).

Nice place to walk around to see art and relax. It doesn't take very long just to walk the park but if you listen to the audio tour it could take a while. If I lived in Des Moines or visited often I would choose one each time to listen to and increase my art knowledge. The art
This Sculpture park is pretty neat. The place is just a nice scenic area in Des Moines and something that adds a flavor to the city along with the rest of it.
Right in the heart of downtown Des Moines, this park really provides a wonderful respite from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. It draws you in to every piece of art; very interactive.
Exceptional sculpture park. Should be a stop for everyone visiting Des Moines if you have any interest in art.
at the edge of downtown is a wonderful sculpture garden - wonderful to stroll through in good weather and appreciate the art!
Beautiful sculpture and grounds. Nice place to walk before or after a meal or people watch. Good place to take a date and enjoy some conversation, the artwork and outdoors.

I had heard of the park, but hadn't seen it. WOW! Great open space with beautiful sculptures. Some of them take a lot of interpretation ; many were just beautiful. What a great site for lunch, walking around, meditating or simply vegging. There is so much more to this park
Really inspiring modern sculpture park. Think a smaller Walker in Minnesota but free. One of the panels in the panaromic awarness pavilion was shattered and diminished the effect
For a short but lovely area, visit this sculpture park. We walked around the block, and then took in the areas with paths for closer looks. Thank you
If you're walking around in the area it's okay to walk through/bike past. I'm also not really into "art" that is abstract.

Nice place for a walk in the park. It would be nice if there were more benches or seats in the shaded areas, in the park, not just the perimeter by the car parking. Lots of nice art, and glad they had a map on the premises to explain the art, some needed some explanation for
Not much to say except there are some cool sculptures and a pleasant walk around. Lots of restaurants and things to see nearby.

For some period of time, Des Moines had an unofficial tag line of, Des Moines...A Surprising Place, and for the most part I think that is very true. The Pappajohn Sculpture Park is one of the examples of what may surprise you about Iowa's Capital City. World renown artists have
Great photo opportunites with all the sculptures. Nice, clean park area in down Des Moines. Our teenage niece really enjoyed the prism. It is worth a stop. Relaxing.
This a unique sculpture park in the downtown area for families to visit and have a picnic. Most of the sculptures are hands off but there are a few that you can go into.
This is a nice stop in Des Moines. There is different types of art all with descriptions. Try it during the day and at night.

This park is a city block just outside of downtown. It's so interesting to get different perspectives on each sculpture. I particularly enjoyed the horse made of driftwood and the big guy made of letters.
Had some time to kill & found this little gem on the edge of town. Would've liked more info on the sculptures but super cool park & cool photo opps.
This park is a must-see period features fabulous artist with all kinds of ingenious sculpture. Very good place to have a photo session with family.

The sculpture park features artwork by some of the world's celebrated artists. Guided tours are available but they are not necessary as anyone is welcome to walk through and around the sculptures. It is a nice welcome to downtown Des Moines.
The Sculpture Park is beautifully laid out and maintained, with an eclectic collection of sculptures. There are maps and signs and you can listen to audio descriptions on your cell phone

Fun to take a stroll through the downtown Pappajohn Sculpture Park. Metered parking is available around the park area. In the summer months, food trucks are located in the area. Be sure to look at the placards for info on the artists. There are also several restaurants in the
Des moines is only about 500k people in the metro area but the sculpture park exemplifies some great art items in a p ark like setting in downtown des moines
This is a nice space to take an outdoor break downtown, but the sculpture on display is not compelling enough to make a special stop.
World-renowned artists' work in a wonderful downtown Des Moines, Iowa setting. Great for a picnic lunch on a beautiful day, too!!

If you are travelling to or through Des Moines this is a must-see! Some very cool artwork and a nice little walk around. A lot of fun on a sunny day. As a bonus there are some great restaurant options nearby (Americana, Proof, Table 39, Magnolia, etc.) As a bonus bonnus... if
This is the definition of accessible art. You walk around and through the various pieces of sculpture on you way to and from lunch, Wellmark or Methodist hospital. Delightful and relaxing stroll.

A very interesting park with unique sculptors. All art prices are presented in an interesting manner. The city has done a wonderful job of creating an attractive park in downtown area for both adults and children.
Nice to stretch your legs and take a little stroll. My son could have cared less about art but I enjoyed.

I've only driven by this park a few times, but it's one of the features of Des Moines that I mention to friends and family. Beautiful, colorful...nice park. Great art! I'll try to stop and linger the next time I'm in Des Moines.

The Sculpture Garden is a point of pride for Des Moines residents. The park offers many different types of sculptures with interesting back stories. The green area is an asset to the downtown landscape. It is close to many popular restaurants and bars.
There are a few interesting looking sculptures. Others are very questionable. It is a nice area though to hang out when the weather is warm
We had a really cool afternoon with the kids wandering through, looking and reading about the art. It's a really great walk and a neat thing to have here in Des Moines.

This is a park that is a couple of city blocks, Be sure to wear good shoes and stay off the grass. Geese have been there before you. The parking is metered, but the Saturday we were there, the meter said “Free Parking”. There is a cellphone guided tour.
Real interesting! A real surprise! Silly amazed at all the neat sculptures! Great way to spend time with family!

It was a rainy day - but that was not the only reason I have only a so-so review for this sculpture park. The sculptures seemed simply to be on display - no sense of context or connection in their placement, with people held a distance with a constant 'see but don't touch'
You will be amazed at the variety, distinctive styles and the number of sculptures in this park. Great for an afternoon walk.

This park contains a variety of sculptures using different media by world class artists. It is unusual to be able to see and walk among works of this caliber in an urban setting. These pieces represent millions of dollars worth of art displayed in an open setting near a nice
Very nice and we'll maintained collection of art pieces that can be related to online many different levels.
Thought provoking and fun sculpture in a nice landscaped park in downtown Des Moines. After a little culture there are plenty of restaurants nearby.
Looking for something to do in Des Moines before our flight out. Every one we spoke with in Ames told us to stop by here. Some pretty neat looking sculptures, beautiful weather made for a nice visit.

This is a favorite spot to bring the teenage girls for photo shoots with their girlfriends. Very trendy and fun park to visit. Reminds you of something you would see in Chicago. Fun for all ages really.

Downtown Des Moines is a great place to visit in the summer. The Pappajohn Sculpture Park area often has food vendors and is a great place to enjoy the outdoors at.

Nice place to stop for a quick walk and a few pictures. The library is close and a Starbuck's on the same block. Fun places to eat close by. Great spot to take a stroll after dinner.
We are so lucky to have such fabulous art available to us in Des Moines. This sculpture park is amazing. Surrounded by tons of great restaurants too. I absolutely love it.
I am impressed by the art and architecture in downtown Des Moines. The Sculpture Garden is a great place for a stroll or to hangout while you have lunch.

The pieces on display are thought provoking. They're spaced apart from each other so that you can take each one in. We went on a super frigid day, so not many people were around. Note that you will need to park at a meter, so bring coins or you can pay with a credit card. We

Wonderful park with some large "other world" type sculptures. Nice wandering cement paths for dog walking and art enjoying. Seemed to be plenty of metered parking available. Be sure you bring a camera and pick up after your pet. The state capitol dome can be seen just down the

Like no other sculpture display. This is an entire park dedicated to amazing sculptures. Some made of bronze, some metal, some stone. Some lifesize, some huge. I especially like the invisible man in the bronze coat. But, I dont get the red metal I beams. Looks like someone
These sculptures are fun to see in person and are surrounded by restaurants within walking distance. Definitely a fun addition to an afternoon trip!
Located in downtown Des Moines, this sculpture park is worth a visit. Features unique and surprising works.
We enjoyed the art. It was quite cold however so we walked quickly! I'd like to see more landscaping perhaps to make the site more varied and interesting.
This park is definitely worth a visit. You can leisurely stroll among the modern sculptures that are interesting to check out and hang out when the weather is good.

I have toured the park five times. It covers several city blocks. There are paved sidewalks that run between the various objects. There are brass plates that tell the name of each work of art. You can tour the park in an hour on a nice warm, sunny day.

We didn't know about this park before arriving to Des Moines. But it was so well signed we decided to check it. We weren't sorry. It's cool. It's suitable for everybody. And it's free. Finding a parking spot was easy.

This park is in a central downtown location, perfect for eating lunch on the lawn, going for a brisk walk, or playing pokemon go ;) It you would like to spend anytime outdoors near downtown Des Moines, I would highly recommend this park.
Had a wonderful time with friends over Thanksgiving break. Ate a bite at Americana then walked through the park. Great place for a photo opp!

The Des Moines Sculpture park is on the West side of downtown Des Moines with parking all around and easy access to a quick oasis of art and turf downtown. My children love to run around the art and get different angles of the artwork and it is a perfect stroll after dinner!
There was a lot of sculptures and art. Nothing AMAZING but nonetheless very interesting. It's a nice view of you want to go for a walk or even a jog.
This is a great place in the middle of Des Moines Iowa. Wonderful sculptures and a beautiful park like setting.

We took two of our adult children to the Pappajohn Sculpture Park when they were in Des Moines visiting, and they were totally impressed by the number and variety of unique art pieces that are permanently displayed here. You won't be disappointed if you take the time to explore

The sculpture garden is a rather unique and unusual feature of the downtown area. I recommend calling the number and hearing the guided tour which gives background on the artists and the sculptures. There is a great variety of work. I enjoyed an evening stroll looking at them

Nice park located very near to the Capitol building and Downtown. Good for a nice troll along the park and see various sculptures. Parking is on the streets and could be difficult to find on a busy day!

The sculpture park is a nice place to take a walk in the city. I find some of the sculptures disturbing and difficult to understand. I am sure it is a wonderful place for people who enjoy that style of art.

Located close to dining, hotels, and a brewery, this sculpture garden is a wonderful green space for the whole family to enjoy, though it was hard for even me (an adult) to not want to climb on certain statuary - just be mindful of the art. The pieces displayed are wonderful to

A nice open block that is stocked with a number of sculptures that are interesting as you roam around. A number of places to sit and have lunch around the park. Not very large with a limited number of sculptures so don't throw too much money in the metered parking that is
Great picture park and lovely open grassy areas. There are several additions since we last enjoyed it.
If you are in downtown Des Moines then it is a decent place to walk through. However it was not something worth making an effort for.
Had a great visit and walk around the art. Has cell phone walking tour also. Beautiful grounds, well maintained.

Tucked away in downtown Des Moines this is such a great place for a walk almost any time of day. Initially we planned just a drive through, but we had to stop and explore many of the fantastic pieces. Don't get too close, a voice comes out of no where saying please back away
We went there for the food truck festival and enjoyed wandering amongst the sculptures. Truly a wide variety of art.
Stopped on a whim for a late afternoon stroll - what a great and calming place! Be careful as it can get crowded quickly. I highly recommend a weekday jaunt through this great park!
Lovely surprise downtown, a real gem. I always check this out when I'm visiting. Nice place for a walk or photos.

Beautiful! Very unique sculptures. Glad we visited the park while we were in town. We went at night so it is pretty nice the way they light them all up. Turned out there was a pokemon go event, so there was a lot of people there that night.

Always nice when a city allows for an open green space. The modern sculptures make this a desirable place around which to live or through which to walk.

This sculpture park is ok. The reviews said go at night. We were there at dusk turning into night. Not sure what the big deal is. I could do most of these sculptures and I have no artistic talent. Not all that impressed.

This was a nice little park with some interesting artwork. The size is about 1 or 2 city blocks and there is plenty to look at. They have some pretty abstract artwork, and there looks to be a lot a people visiting there often.
I went to the sculpture park with my art club. It was very enjoyable except for all the bees and wasps.

This is an interesting place to tour but I would not go great lengths to see it. Its about a square block in the downtown of a small city that is spread out. A nice social place for people to gather. Some sculptures were very interesting and others not so much. There is no

I love visiting the Papajohn Sculpture Park in Des Moines. There are so many interesting pieces, and it is a highlight of the downtown Des Moines experience. And, free and open to the public night and day!

I like the idea of having a park in a city to provide a place for people to gather and enjoy the outside and each other. The art was primarily abstract. The rainbow color panels was our favorite display.

We saw it when we were going to Exile Brewery and came back to check it out. It's a nice walk for a nice day and the sculptures are interesting, some amazing!

Pappajohn Sculpture Park is not just for the art crowd, but an excellent venue for all ages to enjoy. It has a variety of types of sculpture, all of varying sizes and shapes that can be enjoyed at several different angles of the park. It is very clean and well kept, downtown
This is somewhere you can stroll and visit any season of the year. It is free and always very intriguing for new eyes and new visitors to downtown and very intriguing for regulars. Kids love it too.

This is a fun park with lots of neat sculptures. I liked the one with all the different colored glass that you can go inside. However, people really just go to catch lots of Pokemon. There were 4 lures in he park when I went, and the park was swarming with parents and kids
We had been going down to the sculpture park for several weekends now. It is always clean and maintained.

The location is great and the statues are very interesting. They have plaques and cell phone audio tours for each (though we could not get one to load properly) Great family place to get some exercise and culture all at once

It's nice to have a park in the heart of downtown. I love all of the interesting art features which they change up quite frequently. If you work downtown it a nice place to go to get outside and enjoy some fresh air and enjoy the beauty of the city.

Wonderful park. Relaxing/eaceful environment and unique artwork. If in Des Moines, surely worth a visit!
We had so much fun walking around looking at these sculptures. Some were deep and thoughtful and others were just whimsy.

Huge exercise class was in process in sculpture garden while we passed by on way to Saturday Farmers' Market. On Friday we bought lunch from a food truck and enjoyed the nearby Meredith Test Garden. The sculptures are weird but the space is fun and friendly.
We toured the sculpture garden with friends and it was a nice venue to walk and talk but not overly impressive. It's good it is free and for that, I would recommend at least one visit.

Lots of items to view. Many different mediums. Day we were there they had a wedding party there also taking pictures
Fantastic place for cool photos. Wish there were a few more places to sit or to hangout on the green space.

OMG. It's just wonderful. Full disclosure--back in the 1980s, I worked at the Des Moines Art Center and loved the city. But this is really a new and hoppin' place. But back to the Sculpture Park. It's a grassy set of slopes with important and beautifully sited sculptures. It is
very close to downtown Des Moines. I liked seeing the new copper library and then the park. I had good Vietnamese food afterwards at A Dong
This sculpture park is free. It's a city block square. All the sculptures are tagged with the artist's name and the year completed. We enjoyed the walk-about.
The sculptures are really neat and detailed. Had fun taking pictures of it and really enjoyed the park too. Stop by here if you're around the area. Really cool sculptures!

Awesome place to walk around and check out some cool and interesting art, there was even a food truck parked on the corner just a neat place to go, especially if you are into Pokémon Go lots of pokestops and tons of drowzee

There are so many beautiful sculptures to look at. All are so different yet all make quite a statement. Great to just wander through here and plenty of stops to sit and soak it all up.

The Pappajohn family had all of these sculptures in their yard and donated them to the City for the sculpture walk. It's definitely worth the walk thru the park - each sculpture is totally unique and one of a kind.
We had gone to the art museum earlier that afternoon and decided to stop by the outdoor sculpture park before leaving town, and we're very glad we did!

Lots of great areas to sit and relax while the kids ran around catching Pokemon. Lots of families enjoying the park and spending time together. The kids had lots of fun and we were able to relax under a shade tree.

My wife and I went there to check out the art. Our two kids (11 and 13) were there for Pokemon Go. My guess is that about 20% were there for art, 80% for Pokemon Go. Which was fine with us; it was good to see so many people at the attraction compared to the last time we were

Thanks to John & Mary Pappajohn Des Moines has an A rated sculpture garden. Relaxing. Excellent variety of grade A pieces. Surrounded by nice eating establishments. Come yourself and place to be Des Moines proud with out of town guests!

Nice place to walk and see a wide range of sculptures in a variety of materials. I saw a few of sculptors I had heard off.
Pokemon Go and sculpture fun. Great way to connect with your teenage kids. Stations are there to call and find out more about the sculptures.
Very nice. Enjoyed all the sculptures and the park area. Very pretty and kept nice. I think everyone should visit it once.
it is a great place to visit if you have never seen it. it add a very nice green space for downtown. Lately has been over ran by pokemon players

There are so many neat and different sculptures in a space that is big enough that it's not crowded, but yet small enough that you can see everything. Plenty of photo ops and very easy to get around, even for those that have difficulty walking.

High quality sculptures set outdoors near the west end of downtown Des Moines. Many sculptures by recognized artists. My fave is the metal human form composed of letters of the alphabet. It speaks of our inextricable link with language & symbol. Powerful!
very relaxing just looking at the art sculptures and just going for a stroll by yourself or with friends

We were driving cross country and needed a great place to take a little break. This was the perfect location. The sculptures were lovely, the grass is perfectly maintained and there were some fun food trucks on the perimeter to provide lunch. It was just great!!

We liked it. Simple. Nice grassy spot downtown to walk on barefoot. Right-size for younger fams and grandparents. Great addition to the Arts Festival. Think I could have made some of this stuff...ha...
Whilst I'm no art critic I enjoyed looking at the free sculpture park named after the Pappajohns. Well laid out and you can spend as long as you want there. It's free.

Very nice to visit, especially since it is free! The sculptures were very interesting and thought provoking. You can spend as little or as much time as you want to. We found the park on trip advisors and also an app I have called "Roadside Attractions". I felt alittle silly

My husband and I enjoyed a stroll through the park, while the rest.of humanity stared at their phones. Quite comical & enjoyed the peacefulness!
The Sculptures were interesting, and the park well taken care of, but it was crowded with Pokeman players... Not sure I understand...
This was a nice surprise in the city. Great place to wander leisurely in the outdoors. Unique art, great story behind it.

The sculptures are awesome! My boyfriend is not very big into art, but he loved it! The alphabet head is very cool. You can walk right into it, it's huge! The mirror/color exhibit is awesome! You can see about 20 reflections of yourself. It made for some really nice pictures.
This was a very interesting sculpture garden with some very distinctive sculptures. My favorite was the head made out of the alphabet which was big enough to walk inside of it.
Visited the park in the daylight and then returned at night to see that several sculptures were more interesting during the evening.

Neat little park. The kids enjoyed stretching their legs and running around. There was plenty of metered parking along both sides. It was $0.45 for 1 hour. There were also some restaurants right around the park you could grab food at. I don't think it's something we'd do again,
Spent an easy hour meandering the park. Someone has more creative ability than I. Take a camera, and stretch your imagination.
I absolutely loved seeing this place! All the sculptures are a sight to see. So beautiful! My kids enjoyed running around while I was able to enjoy the art.

One square block of large sculptures with a small plaque identifying the artist, year and name of the piece. Some of the pieces are interactive and kids seemed to be enjoying their time there. Plenty of green space to sit and enjoy the view. Wide walking path around and through
This was an interesting and pleasant sculpture park in downtown Des Moines. Interactive interesting sculptures and it is free to visit. There are concerts in the park in the summer.

Very interesting place to visit. Wished I would have known or at least ventured downtown more often when I lived in West Des Moines a few years back so I could see what has changed through the years. My favorite was the horses made from driftwood .

a very interesting park, with many wonderful sculptures. very good for those who like to be outdoors in contact with nature.
Some of the finest pieces of sculptures in the world. A really fun park to wonder through the sculptures with great places to eat and drink around the park

This free park in downtown Des Moines is a pleasant way to spend 10 minutes or 2 hours. There are more than 20 sculptures with winding sidewalks wandering between them. All sculptures are modern art, so if you're looking for a Rodin better head to the Des Moines Art Center. But
The term world-class gets thrown about a lot and often, without merit. The sculptures in this park are truly world-class and by world renowned artists.

Iowa has been great! The sculpture park and the Art Festival was a nice way to spend Saturday. Plenty of people and detailed works of art to enjoy. Children rolling down the hills brought back memories of my childhood home.

This is an easy park to walk around and catch great sculptures/photos on your trip. We went with young children and teens and they LOVED it!!! Beautiful and quirky exhibits and the same time-but all very fun.
A lovely park in downtown Des Moines with interesting sculptures providing an opportunity to leisurely walk around and take in the scene.

I have been to this outdoor exhibit a few times and have seen something different each time. My favorite is the Nomade. Make sure you look at Moonrise from the correct angle. In downtown Des Moines, there are great restaurants nearby. It makes a nice afternoon.
This is a wonderful addition to the city. We enjoyed a casual stroll to and through the garden. Not too abstract so great for a part time art viewer.
This is a downtown art park. Sculptures are interesting and impressive. Plan to spend at least a couple of hours if you really want to enjoy the park. Worth the trip if you are already in the area.
great addition to the Des Moines landscape with open green space for all to enjoy. Onsite metered parking and sometimes host truck food events.

The City of Des Moines has outdone itself in making this homage to the sculptural arts possible. The sculptures are varied. The setting is sublime. This park creates a gateway to the city that took years to establish. It was well worth the wait.

This is a great place to people watch or relax. There are several sculptures to look at (it seems more are added monthly). Right now, it's not crowded with art so there is lots of green space plus places to sit.
Came into town for a conference had a free hour and went to check out the sculpture park. Loved it! Lots of cool pieces ...not huge...but perfect if you have 30-60 min to kill!

This is a world-class sculpture park and has become a favorite destination for both out-of-town visitors and locals wanting an unusual backdrop for photographs. It's open year-round and looks different in every season. Plan to spend about an hour reading about and appreciating
A small, yet wonderful park full of fascinating sculptures in downtown Des Moines. Definitely worth your time.

I visited on an amazing weather day. This park as beautiful sculptures in it, and they are spread out across a huge lawn so you have enough space to admire them without bumping into anyone. There were even people lying under trees enjoying the weather. I was happy to see that

This is a nice place to check out while in Des Moines. There is metered parking all around the park so make sure you have some quarters! The sculptures are well done and spread out over a large area. There is no cost to view the sculptures.
There are some neat sculptures, but it's in a small area, and it's not a place I would visit more then once

If you are downtown you can't miss seeing this park. Modern rabbits sit around ( like one at Washington University in St Louis) and horse like sculptures amid other larger sculptures look strangely at home together in this urban park. It is interesting to walk among the art
This park was located in downtown and was near some other things we went to see. It is totally worth a half hour of time to walk around it and to see the cool sculptures.

You can stroll through this park leisurely and read the provided guided tour booklet to truly understand the works of art and the artists' visions. Or you can let your kids run through the park and pose by their favorite sculpture. There's no right or wrong way to enjoy this

It was a beautiful day to be outside and the walk through the slightly winding path of the Pappajohn Sculpture Park was a perfect setting. There is no admission and no gates that interfere with the beautiful pathways. The park hosts a collection of widely varying sculptures.

Creative and interesting sculpture park just on the outskirts of the downtown core of Des Moines. It's a relatively small park that's easy to walk around, and the sculptures are curious, even enigmatic.
Very unique stop! Even if you don't like abstract or other forms of art, there is something for everyone here!

My husband and I went to college in Des Moines in the 90's. We have made a few trips back and this sculpture park is unique and a lovely addition to the downtown. It makes for some cool photo ops! Highly recommend a stop. It's a quick jaunt, or take a picnic and lounge!

My husband & I visited here on his business trip. Beautiful garden and easy walk and informational. The sculptures and pagoda was beautiful. Right on the river and clean. Only wish that they had a translation plaque next to the stones. All and all a very nice free garden to walk
I didn't like most of the sculptures, but that is dependent on personal taste. It was nice to walk around with my husband and have something to do though.
The sculpture park is a great place to just sit and even greater when the festivals and food trucks arrive. The sculptures are unique and interesting. I think everyone should see them.

This sculpture park is worth your time to stop. I have been here many times, and never get tired of the works of art. It is especially beautiful at night. I was happy to see an exit for the park off of 235, and the food trucks are there. It would be a great place for lunch!

You have to visit the sculpture park during the day and also at night. My favorite has to be the Kaleidoscope, great place to get special pictures. You have to bring your camera. You can get so many cool pictures. I love to also go at dusk and just sit and watch the people
On a nice day, this would be a fun family activity. Great opportunity to get a little art education on vacation.

The artwork displayed here is predominantly attractive and interesting. It's also very wide open. Overall a should-see if you're in the city. There is an area that I didn't like as much, as it seemed to portray "spooky" sculptures. I'm not a personal fan of this, nor do I think

Kids will enjoy these odd sculptures and have fun running around on the grass. It is a great place to have a picnic and The Central Library is also close by (but check library's opening times.) Free fun for all.

After visiting the beautiful classical capitol building, we experienced a total change of perspective by walking through this sculpture park. Very well maintained and presented. We picked up a pamphlet at one end of park and enjoyed our time appreciating the art and artist

Located in the heart of downtown Des Moines, you'll be amazed at these unique sculptures and beautiful park. While you are visiting you can take some really great photos of and with the sculptures and even rent a bicycle to explore more parts of this safe and vibrant city!

Very varied sculpture in a park like setting. another plus is that there are several nice restaurants around the park to have lunch. One can spend more or less time examining the various works depending on your level of interest. A good place for taking photographs.

Visiting this place was a unique and interesting experience in itself. The park is very well maintained and sculptures are unique. Park is open all the time and you can also have a guided tour (call based) if that interests you. It's a small park, easily accessible and right
The sculptures were unique and the park setting made it fun for the entire family. Easy access to the area from downtown.
Open year round. Love it that it is downtown and next to small lunch shops/food trucks. Great to grab a bite and walk around during lunch time.

This is all in about a 2 block space. Nothing exciting except the sculptures are super cool. Make sure you have change for the meters as there doesn't appear to be freee public parking. The sculptures are all unique and it's just a nice little walk in the middle of downtown.

It's a small collection of world class sculptures. I visited on a chilly February day with my young kids who enjoyed walking most of the park before they got bored and I had to get them back in the car before I was done.

Delightful in every way. Great for children an wedding photo opportunities. Everyone should view this treasure. Don't neglect the audio tour available on your cell. Parking was abundant (and free) on this sunny April Saturday.

John and Mary Pappajohn Sculpture Park is in downtown between Grand Ave. and Locust from 13th to 15th streets. There are 27 modern sculptures. Most people like to take picture with Nomade, which was formed by painted stainless steel letters. If you are tired of walking in
Well worth the walk around the garden to view the sculptures. Interesting sculptures and descriptions.
Beautiful walk on a nice day. I'm happy Des Moines has kept some green space downtown and made it interesting with the art. The alphabet head is becoming a DSM icon.
Be prepared to be amazed if you haven't spent time at this site. It is stunning! Not what you may expect of a Midwestern community, but you probably wouldn't find anything like it anywhere.
Pick up a brochure (or not) and enjoy a wonderful 1/2 day walking around the park. The sculpture is fun and highly photogenic. I will return!

I expected a bit more from this sculpture park. I visited in a cloudy day which didn't help. If you have lots of time in Des Moines then it's worth a peek. However, if your time is limited, I would skip it.

While visiting downtown, we like to either drive by or walk through the sculpture park. Its full of curious statues and abstract sculptures that one should see. It is good for a stroll, if you've got a little extra time on your hands.

Everyone should stop in and see the wonderful art work in this park, its a great asset to downtown Des Moines and its close to so many resteraunts. Check it out at sunset if you have time, my favorite time to go.

Definitely come visit the sculpture garden during the fabulous Des Moines Art Festival in June! Unique scuptures donated by John and Mary Pappajohn give the entrance into the city a classy feel. Then stop by Centro for dinner. Across the street, be sure and visit

Des Moines isn't a huge spot for tourists, everyone knows that. If if was, this would be like a mini version of New York central park. Many locals walk around during lunch and on nice weekends many families come out to enjoy the day. Even for people who aren't into art it can be
Excellent afternoon for a walk around the sculpture garden. The brochure is very well done & the sculptures are all wonderful. This is an excellent space in the downtown area.

This is a fun place to walk regardless of month or time of day. The sculpture garden is a great addition to the city and it's a fun place to take out-of-town guests while eating or strolling through downtown.
This sculpture garden is right in the heart of the city. Interesting pieces, and plenty of place to sit, relax, and reflect, as well.
WAlk among these sculptures and ponder the ideas of the sculptors. Enjoy the views of nearby buildings.
One sunny day I had some time so I walked through the park and took many pictures. I enjoyed a bench to sit on and took in the whole experience. A very beautiful experience.
Who doesn't enjoy looking at art especially huge and unusual art pieces . Get a little exercise as you walk around the park. It's a win win!

The multi-block area has many large and wonderful sculptures. Many of which kids can climb. It's a good place for families or individuals to kill time or to become educated concerning art. It's outside vast, clean and there are a lot of eateries within a stone's throw.

Some of the pieces are genuinely good, like the letter man. But some pieces are just plain garbage. Anything can be art anymore, but that doesn't mean that it is or should be. Good place to stroll on a summer day though.

The Sculpture Park is a great place to walk around with friends or on a date. I live in Des Moines and I come here very often because I always find something new that I like about it. It is not super big (it takes up about a block of space), but the art is great and engaging.

Literally and figuratively the art in Western Gateway Park is accessible. You can touch and interact with the art and the art is discernible. We enjoyed the sculptures and the setting. we were there in june so also enjoyed the Des Moines Art Fair.

It's a very nice sculpture park. It makes for an enjoyable evening stroll. It is a well maintained park and a draw to that area. It looked to me like the area is being re-vitalized. A number of people were there enjoying the park.
What a beautiful, unique entrance into the city of Des Moines. Gorgeous winter, spring, summer or fall and provides a magnificent backdrop for food and music events throughout the year.

I always drive by there and never stop. Today, I stopped and slowly walk by things that have been built. It's beautiful art work. I understand puts art work at his home. That's neat. I think everyone in Des Moines or comes to our city, should go visit the art work there.

Interesting sculptures scattered around this urban art park. A little chilly in winter-best visited in the summer when the grass is green. The Des Moines Art Festival is held in this area later in the summer-a wonderful outing!

This sculpture park is one of my favorite places to take visitors to Des Moines. I love that our Art Center members and donors like the Pappajohns make art accessible to everyone, not just the economic elite, in our capital city.

We went in Oct. on a beautiful fall day. Does Moines has put so much time, effort and money into their downtown. It is an attraction for everyone. The sculpture garden was serene, colorful and very unique. The photo ops are amazing. No touching the sculptures but...

Well worth your trip if you are even just a casual art fan. World class sculptures are located in a very nice green space. This neighborhood has been undergoing a major transformation and the results are incredible. Private/public partnership is making this an art destination

This is a testament to the ongoing connection between Des Moines French legacy and it's modern metropolis. Weathering the brutal Midwest winters, stands a public art installation of contemporary sculptures of varying media. Worth the walk through year round.
Really enjoyed walking the kids through the park, always good to see the new additions. Des Moines downtown is filled with wonderful art work

This park is well connected to the downtown area and is a good place to visit while here in Des Moines. It is only a small stroll from any of the downtown hotels and well worth the effort. When I was here they had food trucks surrounding the park, which was an added advantage.

The Pappajohn Sculpture Park is an unexpected treat with its pieces by well-regarded artists in a nicely landscaped green. It is loosely linked to other plazas and a riverside park in downtown Des Moines in a contemporary City Beautiful effort. Together they bring needed open
Very interesting statues, great place to bring a book, or picnic lunch and just sit and unwind. Easy walking distance from the downtown area and hotels.

This sculpture park is unique to Des Moines, Iowa. It is iconic to everyone who lives in the area and for good reason. Right in the heart of downtown this sculpture park is perfect for an afternoon stroll, a picnic or even a place to step out of the office and breathe. It is

Garden is easy to access on drive by or walking . On street parking is available. Sculptures themselves are not overly interesting, and none are titled so very hard to understand artists objectives. However, concept is nice addition to downtown, even if I found the art itself
Found this amazing sculpture garden in the heart of Des Moines. Excellent examples of modern sculpture. Very worth a trip downtown. A great way to spend a sunny day in Des Moines.

I had read mixed reviews of this park before arriving in Des Moines -- so I wasn't sure it was worth seeing -- but I asked a local who raved about it and I'm really glad we took the time. What an interesting mix of fascinating pieces and a beautiful setting (plus it's all free
Really good park with beautiful sculptures. There are cell phone tours available and also booklets at the corner of the place. Made really good pictures over there!
If you're in the city and have some extra time, I would use it to walk the grounds. The time of year and condition of the property probably had something to do with our experience.

After a fantastic wedding anniversary celebration at the Americana Restaurant and Lounge it was the best place to walk - quiet, serene, peaceful and an experience every visitor to the wonderful city of Des Moines should have.

Located in downtown Des Moines Iowa. I went on a Tues and there was plenty of parking nearby (metered took quarters, .50 gave me about and hour) Many sculptures with name titles and artist. There are brochures in a box that tell about each piece or there is a number to call for

Well laid out, large art pieces. Very clean, within walking distance of downtown hotels. Large grassy areas perfect for families with small children to play.

Loved t! I would go at night to see the sculptures when they are lit. Jaume Plensa's piece is certainly the highlight!
This is a beautiful Sculpture Park that probably gets overlooked. I have been there several times taking out of state company. It is especially beautiful at night.

Yes its great that this is free to the public but frankly there is not one sculpture I like (or that anyone else I know likes for that matter) and I can only think the "artists" had to give the pieces away they are so awful. Otherwise, there is grass to walk or sit on which is

This park is one block long and one narrow block wide. Beautiful park with metal and composite sculptures throughout the park. This is a terrific place to take the kids or to just walk around the park and looking at the sculptures. A few are pretty wild but most are
Great place for photos and a brisk walk! If this is your first or one of many trips to the park, you will always find a new treasure.

This is a great place to go when the weather is great and your looking for something free to do. It's located in the heart of downtown Des Moines and there's a lot of parking (on the weekends). Your surrounded by the library, capital, and some amazing restaurants.

We had hoped to park the car and wander but did the slow crawl by as a concert had closed the park and there were no parks handy. What we saw was great and well worth the trip into Des Moines, maybe next time we will get to see them close up.

This large, magnificently carpeted-with-lawn, park provides a wonderful - and surprising - setting for a well-selected collection of large-scale art works, ranging from pure abstract to whimsical to outre to humorous. Our visit was on a warm, sunny day. A 45-minute stroll let

This open air park covering two blocks in the center of the city is an inviting and playful place to visit. Large modern sculptures invite interaction from its viewers. It is very child friendly (rolling in green grass down a small hill has never been so much fun). All viewers

Wide open space in the heart of downtown filled with modern art. The space is easily accessible. My children loved it. I noted that the community uses it as a gathering and interaction space. I saw a yoga class and a book club in progress while there.
